intro: Maesa tabacifolia, commonly known as the tobacco-leaf maesa, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Ericaceae and is characterized by its evergreen shrub form. The plant features elliptical, leathery leaves that resemble tobacco leaves, giving it its common name. It produces small, white flowers that bloom in clusters during the summer months. Maesa tabacifolia is often found in moist, shaded environments such as mountain forests.
